Cuauh_Statement: We approached the strange ships on the horizon, marveling at the pale-faced men who emerged, their armor gleaming like the sun, bringing both curiosity and the weight of an ominous threat to our land
Tlac_Statement: Dear Moctezuma, the Spanish are very smelly and hairy. They need to be extinguished from this land.
Moc_Proc: Sounds reasonable,  I probably wouldâ€™ve wanted to attack them
Poch_Statement: In my observations we attacked the spaniards and lost.
AzPr_Statement: I have seen a number of signs from the gods, telling of a doom that is soon to come. The temples of the gods have shown but a taste of the calamity that is yet to come. It has come to my attention that there are figures that threaten our very being and the existence of this world. Should they reach the city of Tenochtitlan, they will bring about the end of us all.
XY_Statement: I believe that the Tlaxcalan people should not attack the intruders. There are things we could learn from them and they may be able to wipe out the Aztecs. These intruders may be able to take down the Aztecs with all of their new equipment. They may be able to do us a favor and get rid of the Aztecs.
Max_Statement: The Tlaxcalan will NOT attack the intruders. We have seen their demon beasts, and capabilities. We will be precautious of them and see how they can be used to our benefit.

passageHistory.Character assignment and points selectio:
You open your eyes and find yourself staring out a window at the night sky. The noise you heard was the distant rumble of thunder.

You are momentarily disoriented, but this passes quickly as you realize that you somehow know exactly whereâ€”and whoâ€”you are. You are Maxixcatl, a lesser king of the Tlaxcalan confederation. For years, you have bowed to the will of Xicotencatl the Elder, but as the aged ruler nears his end, you wait for your opportunity to claim power for yourself.

You lie on your mat upon the floor listening to the thunder, unsettled by a very clear sense that something is about to happen. For now, you have no choice but to wait for the Gods to reveal their plan. In the meantime, you must complete a small task.

Use the counter below to develop your character. You have 20 points, which you may distribute however you choose between qualities: strength, loyalty, and wisdom. These qualities will be important in the days to come, so choose wisely.




You need to assign points to your character to continue.
Are you ready to begin your journey?
passageHistory.The Library:
It's eight weeks into the semester and you're already drowning in work. You have your first exams this week, you need to get started on some research, and now your history professor has sprung a surprise assignment on you at the last minuteâ€”and it's due tomorrow! The only way you're going to get everything done is to pull an all-nighter. There's no way you'll be able to stay awake at home; your bed is there and it's just too tempting. So you head to the library.

It's 7 pm and the library is more crowded than usual. It looks like you're not the only one with a mountain of work to do this week! There's no way you'll be able to focus in the midst of so many people. Maybe the top floor is quieter. You head upstairs towards the study carrels, but they're all taken. It's dead quiet up here, but there's nowhere to work. You begin wandering down unfamiliar hallways, poking your head into all the different rooms, but none of them work. You're beginning to get frustrated when you notice a door you've never seen before. It's tucked into an alcove in the very back corner of the building. You decide to check this one last spot before you give up and join the masses downstairs.

The door sticks as you try to open it, but you can tell it's not locked. You give it a pull and it creaks open, revealing a tiny room piled high with books and a single, overstuffed chair. There's not a soul to be found. When you close the door behind you, you can't even hear the sound of the H-VAC that hums through the rest of the building. This is perfect. You can't believe your luck!

You unload your books and make yourself comfortableâ€”maybe a little too comfortable. You get to work on your assignment, but within a matter of minutes your eyes get heavy. You struggle to stay awake but it's impossible to focus. Maybe a ten-minute nap will help. You tell yourself that if you just get it out of your system, you'll be good to go for the rest of the night. You close your eyes and quickly slip into a deep sleep.

Suddenly, you're startled by a loud noise!

passageHistory.Quest intro: The Tlaxcalan Legend of Que:
You must wait for enough players to gather to begin.

1 Spanish players have joined the game. You must have at least 3 active players.

5 Aztec players have joined the game. You must have at least 3 active players.

3 Tlaxcalan players have joined the game. You must have at least 2 active players.
passageHistory.Quest: Tlaxcalan instructions:
Maxixcatl, you are quest leader.

You will find the heart of Quetzalcoatl in the city of Cholula. You must travel there to claim the heart and secure his blessing. Your journey will be long and difficult, however, and you will need many resources to sustain you if you are to succeed. Collecting these resources is the key to victory. You have much to prove to Xicotencatl the Elder, and this is your chance. It is up to you to lead your team on this quest!

If you succeed, you will deny legitimacy to the Mexica and maintain the balance of power in central Mexico. The blessing of Quetzalcoatl will surely fuel your warriors and steel you in your struggle against the Mexica. Do not hesitate in this quest, for you are in a race against the most powerful warriors of the Aztec Empire.

When you have read the following instructions and are ready to begin your quest, click the link below to enter the palace.

In the palace you will find 6 place glyphs. Each of these glyphs represents a site of great significance in Central Mexico and in each you will find a vital resource for your journey. In order to collect each resource, you must work with your team to identify the correct name that corresponds with the glyph. Click on each glyph to visit that place and receive a clue to its location. You will need to draw on all your knowledge to solve each puzzle! Once you have figured out where you are, you will enter the name into a text box that is only available on your screen. When you enters the correct response, your entire team will collect the resource located there and you will not be able to return.

When you have obtained enough resources to survive your journey, you will be allowed to travel to Cholula. Because the Aztecs have further to travel, they must gather 5 goods, while you only require 4.

Enter the palace and begin your quest.
passageHistory.Scavenger Hunt Hub:
Click each of the following glyphs to visit key sites around the Aztec Empire. Once you have read the clue and figured out your location, your quest leader must enter the name of the place into the text box provided. When you have obtained enough resources to survive your journey, you will be given the location of Quetzalcoatl's heart.

Remember: You must enter the proper Nahuatl name and you must use the correct spelling! The text box will remain available until you enter the correct response.

passageHistory.Xochimilco:
If you are to survive your journey, you will need to stop first at the place of flowers. Be careful as you seek what you came for, as you could easily get stuck in the mud.
